titlestmt.titleproper: Nelson A. Rockefeller personal papers, Vice Presidential Confirmation, Series N
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller personal papers, Vice Presidential Confirmation, Series N FA1359

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2024-10-01 04:58:49 UTC.
profiledesc.langusage: Description is written in: English, Latin script.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller personal papers, Vice Presidential Confirmation, Series N

physdesc.extent: 5 legal document boxes 4 letter document boxes

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: On August 20, 1974, recently sworn-in President Gerald R. Ford formally nominated Nelson A. Rockefeller to be Vice President of the United States, in accordance with the Twenty-Fifth Amendment of the Constitution. Over the course of the next four months, the U.S. Senate and the House of Representatives held separate, extensive confirmation hearings on Mr. Rockefeller's nomination.

During the hearings, members of the Senate Committee requested substantial documentation related to Mr. Rockefeller's financial and professional activities from the previous decade. This series contains documentation of the efforts by the legal department in the Rockefeller Family Office in New York to respond to those requests, as well as the resulting materials that were provided to the Senate Committee and federal agencies such as the FBI.
On December 19, 1974, Nelson Rockefeller was sworn in as the forty-first U.S. Vice President, having successfully navigated the confirmation process. He served until January 20, 1977.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This small series was originally housed in large binders. The order of the binders has been maintained, with folders on Mr. Rockefeller's personal trusts followed by personal finances. Within the personal finance documentation, there is no Volume 5. The final set of records comprises chronological runs of Nelson Rockefeller's official itineraries and appointments during the last 5 years of his tenure as governor of New York and during the 12 months before his confirmation as U.S. Vice President.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research with select materials restricted as noted. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC.

did.unittitle: Requests for and Deliveries of Information: Nelson A. Rockefeller Trusts Volume 1: Items 1 to 4

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Federal income tax returns for the trust for the benefit of Margaretta Fitler Murphy Rockefeller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Security holdings and summary of provisions of trust created by John D. Rockefeller Jr. for the benefit of Nelson A. Rockefeller.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Various income and summary documents related to trusts for Nelson A. Rockefeller, Margaretta Fitler Murphy Rockefeller, his children, his grandchildren, and Mary Clark Rockefeller; Deed for property on Bedford Road in Westchester County, New York.
